text:
Another super nice paper that found a great home:

academic.oup.com/ej/advance-a...

aaaahhh this new article by @@85681 is so great and informative and fun! A call to think about potential outcomes and causal models even if you don't do experimental work, with all sorts of fantastic DAG examples. doi.org/10.1111/spc3...

Nice to see this out in print: 

academic.oup.com/ej/advance-a...

Even nicer to have all the data and code publically available! 

zenodo.org/records/1049...

Thank you, @@506, Annie, Jessica, and everyone who worked on the TCAI team

What should "educational measurement experts" know, and how should students learn?

Engage us and NCME in debate by submitting a commentary on our "Foundational Competencies in Educational Measurement" Report. Deadline extended to 3/1!

Report: onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/epdf/10....
PISA 2022 will be released tomorrow. Beware the malPISAnce! A good moment to re-read this misNAEPery post by @@44788  twitter.com/AndrewDeanHo... @@38954 #PISA2022 #malPISAnce

There are 1700 IZA Research Fellows worldwide

436 out of the 1700 have signed a letter committing to resign on Jan 1 if Armin Falk is elevated to IZA's top leadership 

This was organized in just a few days

Last weekend, more than 130 development economists presented new research about more than 40 countries on myriad topics. Here’s a micro-summary of every study presented at the North East Universities Development Consortium annual conference. www.cgdev.org/blog/whats-l... by Almedina Music and me

🚨Volume 7 is out!

Handbook of the Economics of Education
Edited w/ Rick Hanushek & Steve Machin

Great overview chapters on cutting-edge topics in the economics of education by top scholars

Have a look!

👉https://www.sciencedirect.com/handbook/handbook-of-the-economics-of-education/vol/7
1/7

Now out in the Economics of Education Review:

A systematic review on the effect of school management training programs in developing countries

with Gautam Anand, Aishwarya Atluri, @@268155 Ketki Sheth

www.sciencedirect.com/science/arti...

"Managing to Learn" is an official @@4101507 working paper! #SabrinBeg, @@487, and I show the importance of engaging managers as leaders in improving public sector service delivery, in this case student learning. www.nber.org/papers/w31757

"The Time Teachers Spend Teaching: What We Know about Time on Task and How to Boost It"

www.cgdev.org/blog/time-te...

Years ago, I helped to measure teacher time on task around Brazil. Today, @@4147180 and I review the latest on how to help teachers optimize teaching time.

Latin #EconKsy: I'm on the ballot for the executive committee of LACEA (lacea.org/portal/index...). I feel humbled to be in such great company. All are top-notch scholars and more importantly amazing people. So there is no way you can go wrong with your vote, but pls vote!

This week's links are now up, with work on environmental economics and development, John List's advice for doing better experiments, Amy Finkelstein on the challenges of experiments in the U.S., and more blogs.worldbank.org/impactevalua...

So HI! We are here now. 

And I wanted to start with a shoutout to all the Data Editors out there: I just got the following message from an author (who has work to do!), and it felt good!  @@184228 (ReStud) + others not (yet) on 📈📉 (Ecta, EJ, CJE, MgmtS, EI, etc. - you know who you are!)

Last week was the conference of the Research on Improving Systems of Education (or RISE) program. Here are 28 takeaways: teachers, technology, long-term trajectories, and more. www.cgdev.org/blog/new-fin....
I looked into this last week and ended up just using a 🟦 github.com/FortAwesome/...
